com.googlecode.batchfb.impl
Class ErrorDetectingWrapper

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.batchfb.util.LaterWrapper<org.codehaus.jackson.JsonNode,org.codehaus.jackson.JsonNode>
      com.googlecode.batchfb.impl.ErrorDetectingWrapper
All Implemented Interfaces:
Later<org.codehaus.jackson.JsonNode>
public class ErrorDetectingWrapper
extends LaterWrapper<org.codehaus.jackson.JsonNode,org.codehaus.jackson.JsonNode>

Detects a Facebook error in the JSON result from a Graph API request and throws the correct kind of exception, whatever that happens to be. It tries to match the type of the exception with an actual exception class of the correct name.

In addition, this detects the REALLY WEIRD cases where Facebook just spits back "false". We translate that into a null.

If there was no error, this wrapper just passes through normally.

Facebook coughs up errors in at least three different formats. This detects them all.

checkForStandardGraphError

protected void checkForStandardGraphError(org.codehaus.jackson.JsonNode node)
The basic graph error looks like this: 
{
  error: {
    type: "OAuthException"
    message: "Error validating application."
  }
}

checkForBatchError

protected void checkForBatchError(org.codehaus.jackson.JsonNode root)
The batch call itself seems to have a funky error format: {"error":190,"error_description":"Invalid OAuth access token signature."}

checkForOldRestStyleError

protected void checkForOldRestStyleError(org.codehaus.jackson.JsonNode node)
Old-style calls, including multiquery, has its own wacky error format: 
{
  "error_code": 602,
  "error_msg": "bogus is not a member of the user table.",
  "request_args": [
    {
      "key": "queries",
      "value": "{"query1":"SELECT uid FROM user WHERE uid=503702723",
"query2":"SELECT uid FROM user WHERE bogus=503702723"}"
    },
    {
      "key": "method",
      "value": "fql.multiquery"
    },
    {
      "key": "access_token",
      "value": "blahblahblah"
    },
    {
      "key": "format",
      "value": "json"
    }
  ]
}
The code interpretations rely heavily on http://wiki.developers.facebook.com/index.php/Error_codes

throwCodeAndMessage

protected void throwCodeAndMessage(int code,
                                   java.lang.String msg)
Throw the appropriate exception for the given legacy code and message. Always throws, never returns.
